usa: Jeannette Rankin of Montana became the first woman elected to the United States Congress.<sup id="cite_ref-67" class="reference">[67]</sup>
The Adamson Railway Labor Act was signed into law.
The Federal Farm Loan Act was signed into law.<sup id="cite_ref-68" class="reference">[68]</sup>
The Jones Act was signed into law.<sup id="cite_ref-69" class="reference">[69]</sup>
United States presidential election, 1916: President Woodrow Wilson was reelected to a second term, defeating Associate Supreme Court Justice Charles Evans Hughes of New York.[70]
australia: Hotels are forced to close at 6 p.m., leading to the beginning of the "six o'clock swill"
Australia suffers heavy casualties in the Western Front Battle of the Somme
The Returned Sailors’ and Soldiers’ Imperial League of Australia, the forerunner to the Returned and Services League of Australia is founded
The Labor government under Billy Hughes splits over conscription. First referendum on conscription is rejected
argentina: Start of presidency of Hipólito Yrigoyen, UCR democratic reformist
